conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation; shadow size is proportional to object size and distance from light source.
Identify objects and shadows: ice cream sundae, typewriter, sphere, pen; shadows labeled A, B, C, D.
Understand relationship between light source and shadows; shadow size is directly proportional to object size.
When light source moves downward, shadows will appear larger.
Shadows will shift downward as light source moves downward.
Shadows will appear larger and shift downward due to proportionality to object size.
Summarize: shadows become larger and shift downward due to light source movement.
Final answer: shadows will become larger and shift downward.
